greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = prime(n)! mod prime(n+1).
comment: By Wilson's theorem, if prime(n+1) - prime(n) = 2 then a(n) = 1.
However a(991) = 1, while prime(992) - prime(991) = 7853 - 7841 = 12. See A286181, A286208, A286230. - _Robert Israel_, Jul 17 2016
link: Chai Wah Wu, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: For n>1, a(n) = 1/((prime(n)+1)*(prime(n)+2)*...*(prime(n+1)-2)) mod prime(n+1). - _Robert Israel_, Jul 17 2016; corrected by _Max Alekseyev_, May 03 2017
For n>1, a(n) = 1/(prime(n+1)-prime(n)-1)! mod prime(n+1) = 1/(A001223(n)-1)! mod A000040(n+1). - _Max Alekseyev_, May 03 2017
mathematica: Table[Mod[#!, NextPrime@ #] &@ Prime@ n, {n, 120}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Jul 17 2016 *)
program: (PARI) a(n,p=prime(n))=my(q=nextprime(p+1)); if(p==2, 2, lift( 1/prod(r=p+1,q-2, Mod(r,q)) ) ); \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Jul 18 2016; corrected by _Max Alekseyev_, May 03 2017
results.author: _Thomas Ordowski_, Jul 17 2016
